abstracts.cdata!:
As part of the agenda in risk management
            related issues, that the World Bank has had with Colombia,
            on Jun 13-15, 2012 was carried out the Workshop
            "Sharing experiences of Colombian cities in disaster
            risk management". This publication is prepared from the
            results of the workshop aimed at sharing experiences,
            lessons learned and gaps that cities have, in order to
            effectively incorporate risk management throughout the
            planning process and the public investment. It is focused on
            5 priority areas: (i) Incorporation of knowledge of hazards
            and risks in planning processes; (ii) Inventories and
            control of high risk settlements (iii) Monitoring of natural
            phenomena and warning systems; (iv) Risk management
            information systems and (v) Institutionalism of public
            administration in disaster risk management. The workshop and
            the document was organized by the World Bank, with the
            support of the National Unit for Disaster Risk Management.
            Likewise, it included the participation of the main cities
            in the country (Barranquilla, Bogota, Cali, Manizales y
            Medellín), and technical-scientific entities at the national level.
